properties.areaDesc: S of Oregon Inlet NC to Cape Hatteras NC out to 20 nm; S of Cape Hatteras NC to Ocracoke Inlet NC out to 20 nm
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 4 at 4:18AM EST until January 5 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
properties.description:
...STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND HAZARDOUS SEAS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE
THROUGH THE WEEKEND... ...LOW WATER CONDITIONS EXPECTED EARLY
SUNDAY MORNING ON TIDAL RIVERS... ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG CONTINUES
THIS MORNING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN WATERS TONIGHT...

.A strong cold front will approach the region tonight and pass
through Saturday. Southwest winds will increase to 20 to 30 knots
this evening over the coastal waters, becoming west to northwest
and increasing to 30 to 40 knots behind the front Saturday night
into Sunday morning.

* WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 30 kt with gusts up to 35 kt
through this afternoon, and then Northwest winds 30 to 35 kt
with gusts as high as 45 kt tonight through Sunday morning. Seas
7 to 10 feet.

* WHERE...The coastal waters from Oregon Inlet to Ocracoke Inlet.

* WHEN...Until noon EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SUNDAY
